subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Filter SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter uses plain text to suppress nearby audit events. The filter can suppress all checks which have Checker as a parent module.

subsection.name: Notes
subsection.p: Setting .* value to nearbyTextPattern property will see any text as a suppression and will likely suppress all audit events in the file. It is best to set this to a key phrase not commonly used in the file to help denote it out of the rest of the file as a suppression. See the default value as an example.

tr.td: Specify check name pattern to suppress. Property can also be a RegExp group index at nearbyTextPattern in format of $x and be picked from line that matches nearbyTextPattern.
Specify check ID pattern to suppress.

Specify negative/zero/positive value that defines the number of lines preceding/at/following the suppressing nearby text. Property can also be a RegExp group index at nearbyTextPattern in format of $x and be picked from line that matches nearbyTextPattern.
Specify check violation message pattern to suppress.
Specify nearby text pattern to trigger filter to begin suppression.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the filter to suppress audit events on the same line:
Example:
To configure the filter to suppress audit events on any line that contains DO NOT CHECK THIS LINE:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="nearbyTextPattern" value="DO NOT CHECK THIS LINE"/> </module> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"/> </module> </module>

subsection.p: Example:
To configure the filter to suppress audit events whose check message contains the word Line. In this case, LineLengthCheck's violation message contains it:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="messagePattern" value=".*Line.*"/> <property name="nearbyTextPattern" value=".*"/> </module> <module name="LineLength"> <property name="max" value="10"/> </module> </module>

subsection.p: Example:
To configure the filter to suppress audit events only on a check whose id is ignoreMe:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="idPattern" value="ignoreMe"/> </module> <module name="LineLength"> <property name="max" value="55"/> </module> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"> <property name="id" value="ignoreMe"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: Example:
To configure the filter to suppress audit events for the current and next 2 lines:
Example:

pre.code: key.one=41 # // SUPPRESS CHECKSTYLE because I want to key.one=42 # ok as within line range key.one=43 # ok as within line range key.two=44 # // violation 'Duplicated property 'key.two' (2 occurrence(s)).' key.two=45

subsection.p: To configure the filter to suppress audit events for the current and previous line:
Example:

pre.code: key.one=41 # ok as within line range key.one=42 # SUPPRESS CHECKSTYLE because I want to key.two=43 # // violation 'Duplicated property 'key.two' (2 occurrence(s)).' key.two=44

subsection.p: To configure the filter with a more compact nearbyTextPattern to accept variable checkPattern:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="nearbyTextPattern" value="-@cs\[(\w+)\] (\w+)"/> <property name="checkPattern" value="$1"/> </module> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"/> </module> </module>

subsection.p: Example:
To configure the filter to accept variable checkPattern and lineRange:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="nearbyTextPattern" value="@cs-: (\w+) for ([+-]\d+) lines"/> <property name="checkPattern" value="$1"/> <property name="lineRange" value="$2"/> </module> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="MagicNumber"/> </module> </module>

subsection.p: Example:
To configure the filter to suppress LineLength violations for lines containing a URL:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="SuppressWithNearbyTextFilter"> <property name="checkPattern" value="LineLength"/> <property name="nearbyTextPattern" value="<a href="[^"]+">"/> </module> <module name="LineLength"> <property name="max" value="70"/> </module> </module>
